p.s: The excerpt at hand is a scene from F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel titled The Great Gatsby.

This novel was published in 1925 and follows the story of Jay Gatsby, a mysterious millionaire, and his pursuit of the American Dream, as well as the pursuit of his long lost love, Daisy Buchanan, through the narrative perspective of his neighbor and good friend, Nick Carraway.
This novel doesn't only focus on Jay Gatsby's rise, but also on his fall.
The following excerpt is about Daisy's and Gatsby's reunion, after not seeing each other in almost five years.
The scene begins with Daisy's arrival at Nick's house.
She follows Nick into the house, but as soon as they enter the living room, Nick comes to find, that Gatsby, who had been there when Nick went to welcome Daisy, is no longer there.
Almost immediatlyimmediately after making this discovery there is a knock on the door.
Nick opens the door to find Gatsby, who without saying a word walks past Nick and goes into the living room.
A few words are said by Daisy from the living room, that are followed by complete silence, which makes Nick walk into the living room to join the conversation.
There are only a few words said between Gatsby and Daisy, so Nick decides to leave the room.
Gatsby however follows him and voices his doubts about the situation.
Nickget'sgets mad at Gatsby and is able to persuade him into going back to Daisy.
While Gatsby and Daisy are in the living room Nick decides to go outside.
As soon as he walks back into the house he is confronted with a crying Daisy and a very happy Mr. Gatsby.
The excerpt ends with Gatsby inviting both Nick and Daisy to his house in order to show them around.
